What you will do The internship/co-op role provides students with the opportunity to apply academic knowledge and skills in a professional environment, and to support/promote the student's career goals through contact with professionals in their field of study. The internship experience enables students to participate in professional activities for Volvo Group Trucks by working on important and innovative projects. Internships are structured learning experiences where interns/co-ops and our full-time professionals work together on projects within their selected organization. The internship allows students to integrate knowledge and skills in a manner that is mutually beneficial to the student and the Volvo Group Trucks. Core Responsibilities: • The applicant will be responsible for supporting lean and continuous improvement projects on-site and work on multiple projects to improve operational efficiency. • Assist with the development and implementation of new Standard Operating Procedures and reporting systems • Develop tools using Microsoft Office products in conjunction with in-house operating systems to support operational needs • Support with process data analysis • Development and implementation of new process flows and work area designs to maximize efficiency and improve workplace ergonomics • Curiously investigate everything - the ability to solve problems analytically, creatively and collaboratively • Learn by doing - an entrepreneurial mindset that's driven by hands-on experimentation • Embrace resilience - seeing every challenge as a learning opportunity and an invitation to grow • Availability of 40 hours per week within M-F 7:30-19:00. Final schedule to be agreed upon with the manager. Ready for the next move? Throughout the experience, the manager will provide written and/or verbal feedback until project's conclusion. A final formal written evaluation based on performance will also be provided.
